TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ServiceDescription extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a complete, in-memory description of the service, including all the endpoints for the service and specifications for their respective addresses, bindings, contracts and behaviors.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The information contained in the ServiceDescription is used by the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] system to building the run-time components for the service.
Use this method when adding custom behaviors to extend <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost>. Programmatically, you must <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601.Add%28%600%29> the custom service behavior to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Behaviors%2A> prior to when you call the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.Open%2A> method on the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost> object.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.GetService%28System.Object%29> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.GetService%28System.Type%29> methods are available to reflect on behaviors using the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] programming model when replacing <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase> with you own hosting mechanism.
Export metadata about a service endpoint by passing <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> as a parameter to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.ExportEndpoint%28System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%29>. After calling this method, or one of the other export methods provided by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter>, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.GeneratedWsdlDocuments%2A> property to return the collection of <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> objects.
## Examples The following example illustrates various ways to instantiate a ServiceDescription object.
[!code-cs[S_UE_ServiceDescription#0](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.servicemodel.de_20_1.cs)] [!code-vb[S_UE_ServiceDescription#0](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.servicemodel.de_20_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> endpoints) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> of type <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> used to initialize the service description.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a specified enumeration of service endpoints.
Gets the behaviors associated with the service.
Docs.value: The <xref:System.Collections.Generic.KeyedByTypeCollection%601> of type that contains the behaviors associated with the service.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method when adding custom behaviors to extend <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost>. Programmatically, you must <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601.Add%28%600%29> the custom service behavior to the Behaviors prior to when you call the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.Open%2A> method on the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost> object.
The type of behavior that is accessible from the description hierarchy is scoped to the specific level. From the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription> the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IServiceBehavior> is accessible.
If you want access to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior> associated with an endpoint instead, you can obtain the endpoints for the service using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Endpoints%2A> property. Then retrieve the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> from the collection with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpointCollection.Find%2A> method that employs the relevant search criteria, and call the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.Behaviors%2A> property to obtain the collection of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior> objects.
## Examples [!code-cs[S_UE_ServiceDescription#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.de_27_1.cs)] [!code-cs[S_UE_ServiceDescription#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.de_27_1.cs)] [!code-vb[S_UE_ServiceDescription#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.de_27_1.vb)] [!code-vb[S_UE_ServiceDescription#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.de_27_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the <> configuration element.
Docs.value: The name of the [\<service\>](../Topic/%3Cservice%3E.md) configuration element used to configure the service.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This name is not coupled to our configuration model. This is used by service host base to wire up the service. The configuration name is a required string attribute for the [\<service\>](../Topic/%3Cservice%3E.md) configuration element.
## Examples [!code-cs[S_UE_ServiceDescription#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.de_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[S_UE_ServiceDescription#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.de_0_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of endpoints from the service description.
Docs.value: The that contains the endpoints defined for the service.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The endpoints in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpointCollection> returned by this method each contain the address, binding, contract, and behavior information required to communicate with the service. To access this information, you must retrieve the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> from the collection with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpointCollection.Find%2A> method that employs the relevant search criteria. Then the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> properties can be used to access the information. For example, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription> is accessed by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.Contract%2A> property.
Export metadata about a service endpoint by passing <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> as a parameter to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.ExportEndpoint%28System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%29>.
## Examples [!code-cs[S_UE_ServiceDescription#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.de_2_1.cs)] [!code-vb[S_UE_ServiceDescription#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.de_2_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription GetService(object serviceImplementation) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a service description initialized with a specified service object.
Docs.returns: The for the service object provided.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to reflect on behaviors using the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] programming model when replacing <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase> with you own hosting mechanism.
GetService initializes the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Name%2A>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Namespace%2A>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.ConfigurationName%2A> properties, and ensures that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceBehaviorAttribute> is attached to the service and adds any relevant service behaviors to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Behaviors%2A>.
## Examples The following sample shows how to iterate through the service behaviors contained in the service description.
[!code-cs[S_UE_ServiceDescription#9](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.servicemodel.de_9_1.cs)] [!code-cs[S_UE_ServiceDescription#9](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.servicemodel.de_9_1.cs)] [!code-vb[S_UE_ServiceDescription#9](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.servicemodel.de_9_1.vb)] [!code-vb[S_UE_ServiceDescription#9](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.servicemodel.de_9_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription GetService(class System.Type serviceType) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a service description initialized with a specified service type.
Docs.returns: The for the service type provided.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to reflect on behaviors using the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] programming model when replacing <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase> with you own hosting mechanism.
GetService initializes the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Name%2A>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Namespace%2A>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.ConfigurationName%2A> properties, reflects on the type for any the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceBehaviorAttribute> objects and adds them to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Behaviors%2A>, and ensures that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceBehaviorAttribute> is attached to the service.
## Examples [!code-cs[S_UE_ServiceDescription#10](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.servicemodel.de_2_1.cs)] [!code-vb[S_UE_ServiceDescription#10](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.servicemodel.de_2_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the service.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the name is `null`, this property returns the name of the service type. If service type is also `null`, it returns the default service name.
When exporting WSDL metadata, the Name maps to the Web Service Development Language (WSDL) <`service`> element local name part of the (qualified) `name` attribute.
## Examples [!code-cs[S_UE_ServiceDescription#6](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.de_3_1.cs)] [!code-vb[S_UE_ServiceDescription#6](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.de_3_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the namespace for the service.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When exporting WSDL metadata, the Namespacemaps to the Web Service Development Language (WSDL) <`service`> element namespace name part of the (qualified) `name` attribute.
## Examples [!code-cs[S_UE_ServiceDescription#7](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.de_22_1.cs)] [!code-vb[S_UE_ServiceDescription#7](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.de_22_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the service.
Docs.value: An instance of the <xref:System.Type> that implements the service.
